_header: Weak and wretched thou art in sight
_description: The Ten Ages of Man’s Life — ten couplets

BLHar7322.First Lines: waich & wreschede þou art in sithof alle maner beste lest is ti mith…
BLHar7322.Last Lines: …Of þi lif nou litil letefor þou art tornid to wormis mete
BLHar7322.Note: Written as prose, inserted into Latin with Latin text separating couplets and all preceded by a macaronic on three measures of man’s life, “Vita hominis declarit in—10 horis 10 dictis 10 radiis—In—ten times of þe day ten stappes of oure wey ten spokes þat tornen ay.”
BLHar7322.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
